Analysis includes the function \\( h(z) = e^{Pt}z \\), where P is also a complex constant, representing an operational transformation.

Assuming a new intervention \\( k(z) = e^{Rt}z \\) where R is a complex constant is applied at time \\( t_1 \\), will the state \\( z(T) \\) for T>t_1 solely depend on Q and not on P or R?
